activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dalton M McClure

records.addlTxt:
11:09 AM Defendant Dalton M McClure in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman not in court.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State relates preliminary hearing was waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Court reserves pre plea rights. Plea set and reminder note given in court.  Bail continues.
Plea hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 10:00 am.

1:35 PM Defendant Dalton M McClure in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Dalton M McClure.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Erdman relates on waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court questions Defendant.  The Court finds waiver is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given, finds probable cause, and binds over for trial. Arraignment set.  Address confirmed and phone number provided/updated.   Reminder note given to the Defendant
Arraignment scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must have no contact with M.S.S.

10:38 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dalton M McClure in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Dalton M McClure. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives further reading of same.
Preliminary hearing requested; waiver of time limits. Must appear in person.
Bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
